thread.title: Istanbul nightclub gunman captured on CCTV
thread.title_full: Istanbul nightclub gunman captured on CCTV

author: Telegraph Reporters
title: Istanbul nightclub gunman captured on CCTV
text:
Istanbul nightclub gunman captured on CCTV Watch | Istanbul nightclub gunman captured on CCTV 00:36 Telegraph Reporters 1 January 2017 • 9:40am 
S urveillance footage appears to show a gunman spraying bullets outside an Istanbul nightclub before entering and shooting dead at least 39 people. 
Armed with a long-barrelled weapon, the attacker shot a police officer before storming the elite Reina club in the Ortakoy area of the city at about 1.45am. 
There were believed to be more than 500 people in the club at the time of the attack, in the early hours of New Year's Day. 
Partygoers – including men in suits and women in cocktail dresses – were seen emerging from the nightclub in a state of shock. 
Another CCTV image is believed to show the attacker changing his jacket as he walks around inside the club. 
The whereabouts of the attacker was still unknown and some reports suggested there were multiple attackers. 
Turkish Interior Minister Suleyman Soylu said the gunman was still at large. "The search for the terrorist continues... Our security forces have started the necessary operations. God willing he will be caught in a short period of time." 
He said that of 21 victims who had been identified so far, 16 were foreigners and five were Turks. Another 69 people were being treated in hospital for their wounds. 
It is not known if any Britons were among the casualties.
